meanings.definition: An underground reservoir for liquid waste.
meanings.sent1: The old house had a cesspool in the backyard for waste.
meanings.sent2: The workers had to clean out the cesspools to prevent contamination.
meanings.sent3: The cesspools in the city were so full that they started to overflow.
meanings.sent4: The cesspools of pollution were slowly seeping into the ground.
meanings.sent5: The smell from the cesspools was unbearable on hot days.

meanings.definition: A place or situation that is foul, corrupt, or morally debased.
meanings.sent1: The abandoned building was a cesspool of crime and illegal activities.
meanings.sent2: The internet can sometimes be a cesspool of negativity and hate.
meanings.sent3: The gossip at the office turned the workplace into a cesspool of rumors.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a cesspool of dark thoughts that he couldn't shake off.
meanings.sent5: The cesspool of lies eventually caught up with the dishonest politician.
